content.description: On the left side of the boulder, either start from a stand or a sit for about the same grade, we found the easiest sit to be below the V1 start and then working left, but saw it described as being on the left with a left hand sidepull. Choose your own adventure. Arrive at the two small crimps used for the stand start, work your way up to a sharp crimp for the left hand. Use good feet and body position to utilize some underlings and reach for the top. Excellent rock
content.location: Left side of the motherlode boulder. Find two obvious crimps in the rail running across the boulder, just to the left of the big V1 start jug

content.description: Easily the best climb in the area. Low start on great holds into slopey, friction goodness, followed by thinning holds and a reach for the juggy top.
content.location: Start low on the right of the creek face. Climb the leaning, slopey edge up and left, then directly up to great jugs.

content.description: Start with locker handjams, work up through the bulge on some face holds and top out using jams and face holds. Or dyno up and right at the start to huge jug on the right.
content.location: Obvious crack on the right side of the motherload boulder.
Start on a great, right facing jug at head height on the more upstream end of the face. Climb right and up on good holds.

content.description: Sit start right of the crack on two Obvious Holds. Move left to pinch, get a heel hook, move the left hand up (compress) and make big move right to jug. Finish on crack.
